summary: The San, also known as Bushmen, are indigenous hunter-gatherers from southern Africa. They live in countries like Botswana, Namibia, and South Africa. San people speak unique languages called Khoe, Tuu, and Kx ºa. Historically, they lived in a vast area, but now, Botswana has the highest number of San people, around 63,500, making up 2.8% of its population. They are known for their ancient culture, distinct from neighboring groups who practice farming or herding.
title: San people
